name: Unium
description: Draw a line. A single line. How complex can that be?
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: 1GHz processor Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 3D graphics card with 512Mb DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 50 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: 2GHz Dual Core processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 3D graphics card with 512Mb DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 50 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Sound Card

reviews.review_text: This game was a blast. You can play it whether you have a little or a lot of time. A warning though - it is addictive so 'a little time' can easily turn into a lot if you have nowhere to be.  There's nothing bad to say really. You'll only not like Unium if you're impatient or not into puzzle games.  The difficulty ramped up well - you'll probably breeze through the Beginner and Easy levels, then start slowing down mid-way through Medium until you find yourself spending potentially hours to crack some Advanced levels (the bulk of the game is in Advanced).  Half of the achievements also give some incentive to re-do a few levels with more constraints, giving them some new life.  The music provided a nice, unobtrusive ambience that worked even for hours of play at a time.  Unium is very polished for an indie game. The UI, sound, achievements, level design, and length all feel perfectly cohesive. And it's 2 bucks!

I love this game. It's price point is cheap (that said there is no replayability here). It's a true mind bender that is simple to understand and get the hang of.   PROs +It's innovative and different +Simple to play +Cards and Achievements (for $1.49 @25% off - you can't go wrong)  CONS +It's too easy to look at a guide..!  SUGGESTIONs? +DEV may consider adding custom level(s) or workshop (but again for $1.49 it's not a complaint)  10/10

A decent puzzle game with a unique concept of drawing a line through black squares to complete an image. The game is worth it's price, but is it revolutionary? no. It's nice that it has various difficulty levels but sadly there aren't many mechanics. You can't play this game in long sittings as you start seeing the optical illussion of dots at the intersections lol (issue of the game being back and white). It doesn't have that many levels nor appeal as Lyne. If you are thinking about grabbing this or some other puzzle game, I would recommend prioritizing another over this one.

A nice, inexpensive, brainteasing puzzle game. Puzzles start out extremely easy, but get a lot tougher as you progress. Runs on anything and works well with touchscreens. That combination makes it a perfect fit for some light casual gaming on a Windows tablet, but I enjoyed playing it on my desktop, too. For just a buck or two, you really can't go wrong if you enjoy solving puzzles.
A nice and casual puzzle game.  Easy at first, hard after 70% of the levels.   There's for 4 hours of playing here, it's definitely worth the price.

AMAZING game for its cheap sale price. 125 levels ranging from beginner to advanced, with community custom levels and a level editor. This game will make you think with its simplisted yet somewhat frustratingly hard levels. Great game to pass time.
It's a puzzle game where you draw a line.  10/10
It's a great game! Beginner to medium levels are quite easy, but Advanced levels provide a decent challenge. I'm playing it as a warm-up for The Witness.

The main aesthetics for this game are challenge and submission. It's a puzzle game (challenge) and it's repetitive enough that it's a good time waster (submission). The mechanics are simple as you just trace a path with your mouse and the line follows. The music is pretty soothing and something about the sound effects are pretty satisfying to hear, especially if you run your mouse down a line quickly.   The game has 4 levels of difficulty and each level has a lot of puzzles. It's easy to get to the advance levels pretty quickly and there are about 60 advanced puzzles, so there isn't a lack of things to do.   Pros:  + They advertise a puzzle game with a simple mechanic and that's exactly what you get.  + Difficulty tiers all have numerous puzzles so there's plenty to solve at your desired difficulty + Sound effects are fun. Music is soothing, though a little sleep inducing because it's so calm  Cons: - Eventually you'll run out of levels (though there are specific achievements for specific puzzles) - I have a short attention span so this isn't going to be a game that I'll play for a long time.   In short, if you want a simple puzzle game that has varying levels of difficulty and you like what the screenshots have, then this is a pretty nice game to have.
